DOC.brief_summary: This study conduct assess relative bioavailability MTX administer subcutaneously via prefilled pen ( 50mg/mL ) compare MTX administer via IM injection ( 25mg/mL ) .
DOC.brief_title: Bioavailability Patient With Psoriasis : Metoject Prefilled Pen
DOC.criteria: Is able understand follow instruction study Has diagnosis moderate severe psoriasis base dermatologic evaluation Provides write informed consent Is male female age 18 65 year , inclusive Has body mass index ( BMI ) within range 18 30 kg/m2 . Main Is receive concomitant treatment psoriasis biologic conventional systemic treatment ( eg , cyclosporine , azathioprine , fumaric acid ester , Leflunomide ) , MTX every week Has use antibiotic within 14 day prior Screening require use prior study completion Has use follow medication within 14 day prior Screening require use prior study completion , unless stable , daily dose : Non steroidal antiinflammatory drug ( NSAIDs ) , Diuretics , Folic Acid , Hydrochloroquine , Probenicid , Protonpump inhibitor Has , psoriasis , uncontrolled cardiac disease , liver disease , lung disease , hematologic disease , gastrointestinal disease , systemic disease , opinion investigator , would present unacceptable risk participate study Has ongoing acute chronic infection within 14 day prior Screening Has renal insufficiency , hepatic insufficiency , impaired hematopoiesis , know severe , acute , chronic infection , history malignancy , history suspect abuse drug alcohol allergic reaction serious adverse reaction study drug Is female subject pregnant , try become pregnant , breast feeding , childbearing potential , sexually active practice highly reliable method birth control Is male subject female partner childbearing potential , vasectomy use condom and/or cervical cap/diaphragm spermicide
